places.name: Fantastic Magic Camp
places.summary: Imagine a place where... Kids discover their unique inner Magic through learning magic tricks. Campers are surrounded by people both young and old who recognize and embrace that uniqueness. A shy little girl learns to express herself through the actions of a puppet. Both the timid and adventuresome discover that they can master things they never dreamed they could do, like making cards appear out of thin air, balancing on stilts and riding a unicycle. Children get to engage in robust physical activity and games without ever worrying if someone will pick them to be on a team. Every day is filled with fun, laughter and lots of surprises. Everyone makes friends and learns to care for each other because nothing else makes sense. That is Fantastic Magic Camp, where, after nearly a quarter century, we continue to work Magic with kids! Fantastic Magic Camp is a multi-sensory learning experience that uses the fun of magic, puppets, and juggling to enhance campers' self-esteem and teach important life skills through modeling appropriate behavior. Fantastic Magic Camp maintains a teacher-to-camper ratio of 5 to 1 or better, with adult staff members, teenage counselors, and counselors in training. In addition, there are guest performers and teachers sharing their expertise throughout the sessions. Parents are welcome to visit at any time.

places.name: Austin Neuropsychology, PLLC
places.summary: We work with you, your family, and other providers to provide information about cognitive strengths and weaknesses that cannot be attained from other diagnostic procedures. We help you understand how problems with the brain may relate to problems seen at school/work, home, or with peers. We work with other doctors, teachers, and therapists to develop a comprehensive treatment plan to address your (or your child’s) weaknesses and utilize strengths to compensate whenever possible. We will make specific treatment and/or environmental recommendations to help you achieve your goals. Clinical neuropsychology is focused on understanding the link between the brain and behavior. For example, how the health of the brain affects the ability to pay attention, remember, or solve problems. We use this information to diagnose and treat brain disorders. Suggested Psychologist: Melissa Bunner, Ph.D. sramirez@neuroaustin.com

places.name: Behavior Frontiers
places.summary: Behavior Frontiers offers exceptional behavior intervention services to Austin and surrounding areas in Texas. They are NOW ACCEPTING new clients with autism or other special needs into their applied behavior analysis (ABA) treatment programs.  Their comprehensive treatment program is conducted in the child’s natural setting such as his/her home school or community. Our highly-trained team of behavior supervisors and instructors work together with family members and other professionals to target the reduction of problem behaviors and the improvement of a variety of age-appropriate skills such as socialization and communication.

address.formatted: 12015 E 46th Ave #680, Denver, CO 80239, USA

places.name: Rosedale School
places.summary: For families whose children have severe special needs, the Rosedale School offers one simple message: Your child is welcome here. The school's well-experienced educators serve students who have significant disabilities, including children who are medically fragile or who need intensive behavioral support. Rosedale, nestled in the Central Austin neighborhood that bears its name, offers a caring, family-focused community that supports students’ unique learning needs in a positive environment. Through Rosedale's tailored educational opportunities and quality instruction, students increase their independence, improve their self-esteem and experience a greater quality of life. Students who are 18 to 21 years old can apply to participate in the GO Project, a community-based, transition program to move from the high-school setting to a college or work environment. Rosedale also houses the Transition to Life in the Community program, often referred to as TLC, which focuses on preparing students for life after graduation. Serving and empowering students who have special needs with love and respect, Rosedale is among Austin’s most beloved schools. Every year, students and teachers dress up for a much-anticipated prom and school champions hit the road for the Rosedale Ride.

street_name.long_name: East Martin Luther King Junior Boulevard
street_name.short_name: E Martin Luther King Jr Blvd

places.name: Sheri Michelle Ravenscroft, MD
places.summary: I entered health care to help care for patients with special healthcare needs. I was inspired by my time working as a volunteer at a local therapeutic horseback riding facility. Seeing the positive changes that take place when a child is empowered left an impression on me that led me to my particular field of practice. As a developmental pediatrician, I am interested in helping every child have access to appropriate treatment programs in their community. I recently completed research regarding the impact of home-based parent mediated autism treatment program on parental stress profiles. I am interested in treating patients across all ages and developmental domains including speech and language delay/disorder, general developmental delays, behavioral concerns, autism spectrum disorder, ADHD, learning disabilities, anxiety and depression, and genetic syndromes including Fragile X.

places.name: Specially For Children
places.summary: Specially for Children is a pediatric sub-specialty group affiliated with Ascension Dell Children's Medical Center in Austin, Texas. The Central Texas pediatric sub-specialty group Specially for Children has eight outpatient clinics in Austin, College Station, Kyle, Round Rock and San Angelo. The doctors and care teams deliver multi-specialty pediatric care to children of all ages, including teenagers. Established in 1996, the Specially for Children pediatric group now represents more than 15 different pediatric specialties. These experienced doctors listen to understand your concerns. places.name: Crenshaw Athletic Club
places.summary: All-day camp and afternoon sports camp offered. Minimum requirements for participation would be the ability to stay with the group and not be disruptive. Thereafter, participation would depend upon the difficulty of the sports. Parents are advised to come by and watch the program to see if it is appropriate for their child. Regular gymnastics and swim lessons also offered.

address.formatted: 5000 Fairview Dr, Austin, TX 78731, USA

places.name: Dougherty Arts Center
places.summary: Provides a variety of multi-disciplinary classes, workshops and camps including painting, drawing, photography, pottery, metals, dance, jewelry, fiber, computer graphics, animation, drama and much more. Summer camp registration begins in February

address.formatted: 1110 Barton Springs Rd, Austin, TX 78704, USA

places.name: From the Heart Therapy Services
places.summary: From the Heart Therapy Camps Occupational and Speech Therapy clinic that provides Spring break, summer, and holiday camps, respite/date night, social skills groups, and much more. These additional programs are designed to enhance supplementary therapy by working on fine motor skills, handwriting, gross motor skills and social interaction skills, and can also include various fitness activities.​ Camps are offered to children who participate in the therapy program at FTH Therapy Services.

address.formatted: 4613 Bee Cave Rd, West Lake Hills, TX 78746, USA

health insurance: Blue Cross Blue Shield (BCBS) PPO Plans
Aetna PPO/HMO/EPO (some plans from the exchange we are out of network)
Multiplan Shared Savings Plans / Private Health Care Systems (PHCS) Network PPO
Medicaid Traditional (at this time for OT only)

places.name: ESTEAM Learning Labs
places.summary: The mission of Learning Fun 101 is to provide a fun interactive learning experience that improves students’ aptitudes in Science, Technology, Engineering, the Arts, and Math (STEAM). Year round program offers Engineering, Programing and Robotics using LEGO® WeDo Robotics Systems (LEGO® Education’s award-winning construction kit and software designed for kids ages 4 to 7) and the LEGO® MINDSTOM® NXT and EV3 construction kits for kids ages 8 and up.

address.formatted: 12 Lake Dr, Round Rock, TX 78665, USA

places.name: Austin Miracle League
places.summary: Provides opportunities for any child, with a physical or mental special need, to play baseball regardless of their ability. Players are paired with a buddy age 12 or older. A Buddy is a middle school or high school volunteer. This buddy will allow them to be safe and play to the best of their ability. Our program is non-competitive, fun focused with a 7-game season, both in Fall and Spring

address.formatted: 13300 Morris Rd, Austin, TX 78729, USA

places.name: North Austin Optimist
places.summary: We are a non-profit organization dedicated to bringing out the best in children, in our community, and out of ourselves. Champions baseball league is for children with mental or physical disabilities.

address.formatted: 1105 Morrow St, Austin, TX 78757, USA

places.name: Odyssey School
places.summary: Odyssey Summer Camp is designed to be a bridge between school years, making the summer a chance to continue academic growth rather than a time to fall behind. Camp Odyssey features one-week half- day mini-camps that will focus on creative explorations and academic investigations.

address.formatted: 4407 Red River St, Austin, TX 78751, USA

places.name: RED Arena
places.summary: Inclusive Summer Horse Camp for riders of all ability levels. Includes group trail rides, hands on horse care, gross motor games, fine motor crafts. Also offers equine assisted therapies, therapeutic riding lessons, and more.

address.formatted: 2435 W Fitzhugh Rd, Dripping Springs, TX 78620, USA

places.name: ROCK - Ride on Center for Kids
places.summary: Provides equine-assisted therapies and activities to children, adults and veterans with physical, cognitive and emotional disabilities. R.O.C.K. clients see improvement in most aspects of their life; from muscle tone, strength, flexibility, and balance to cognitive, behavioral and emotional improvements. R.O.C.K.’s mission is to improve independence and life skills in partnership with the horse. There are various programs offered throughout the year. Space is limited and available on a first come first served basis.

address.formatted: 2050 Rockride Ln, Georgetown, TX 78626, USA

places.name: Clay Madsen Recreation Center
places.summary: This program offers daily activities for individuals with disabilities including sports, drama, cooking, crafts and theme based field trips. Youth Camp ratio is 1:4. Teen Camp ratio is 1:5. Campers must be able to self-manage behavior and function within this ratio.

address.formatted: 1600 Gattis School Rd, Round Rock, TX 78664, USA

places.name: South Austin Karate
places.summary: After school programs (includes holidays) and summer camp. In addition to Martial Arts training, the participantsm will go on field trips, movies, and more. Call to make sure they can accommodate your child; SAK believes in an inclusive model when working with individuals with disabilities.

address.formatted: 10203 Old Manchaca Rd, Austin, TX 78748, USA

places.name: Spark Learning
places.summary: Welcoming campers with ASD, ADHD, language delays, other related challenges, and their typically developing siblings and friends. ABA therapists will meet the social, language, behavioral and developmental needs of all campers in a low ratio, inclusive therapeutic environment. Campers are carefully matched by age, language, play, and social skills.

address.formatted: 2517 Enfield Rd, Austin, TX 78703, USA

places.name: Texas School for the Deaf
places.summary: Texas School for the Deaf is a state-operated primary and secondary school for deaf children in Austin, Texas. Opened in 1857 "in an old frame house, three log cabins, and a smokehouse", it is the oldest continually-operated public school in Texas.

address.formatted: 1102 S Congress Ave, Austin, TX 78704, USA

places.name: Texas School for the Deaf-Summer Camps & Programs for the Deaf and Hard of Hearing
places.summary: The Educational Resource Center on Deafness (ERCOD) at Texas School for the Deaf (TSD) is proud to offer many specialized summer camps & programs for preschoolers to young adults who are deaf and hard of hearing in Texas during the summer of 2019, with a focus on each participant's particular interests. Prior knowledge of sign language is not required to join the fun and unique language-rich experience. Visit our website to register!

address.formatted: 1102 S Congress Ave, Austin, TX 78704, USA

places.name: Texas School for the Deaf-​Family Weekend Retreat ​ (FWR)
places.summary: This Virtual weekend retreat is for Texas families with deaf or hard of hearing children, 6 months-18 years, and their hearing siblings. ​ ​ ​ Adults will attend educational workshops and learn about the many opportunities for communication and education for deaf and hard of hearing children. Workshop presenters include a variety of professionals as well as parents and deaf and hard of hearing adults. There will also be many activities where families can meet each other.

address.formatted: 1102 S Congress Ave, Austin, TX 78704, USA

places.name: The Dog Alliance
places.summary: Summer camps for students who love dogs. Campers ages 9 and older bring their own dog to camp with them. If their own dog is not suitable, campers can borrow a trained dog for the week. Our goal is to accommodate the varying abilities of students whenever possible. Please contact us to discuss.

address.formatted: 1321 W New Hope Dr, Cedar Park, TX 78613, USA

places.name: Thinkery
places.summary: Offers camp during spring break and summer. Camps are designed around seven unique STEAM and technology-focused themes. Campers learn through play, using stimulating science and hands-on activities to explore new concepts, solve challenges, and develop critical learning skills​

address.formatted: 1830 Simond Ave, Austin, TX 78723, USA

places.name: Variety Arts Performance Camps
places.summary: Variety Arts is happy to host ​ a performance camp for students with Down Syndrome and Autism Spectrum Disorder. Each week, students will learn skills in acting, singing, and dancing while starring in a musical showcase. All students will have speaking parts, sing some of their favorite musical tunes and pop songs, dance and learn choreography, and perform in a fabulous performance for family and friends complete with lights and costumes. All skills and parts in the show are modified to show off each student’s strengths and improve individual goals working closely with the class Teaching Artist and Behavior Interventionist. The performance will be held on the last day of class and is free for family and friends.

address.formatted: 5555 N Lamar Blvd Suite C-102, Austin, TX 78751, USA

places.name: Variety - the Children's Charity of Texas
places.summary: At Variety, we believe that every child with special needs deserves to reach their potential regardless of their social or physical limitations.  By providing funding for therapy, wheelchairs, walkers, specially designed adaptive bicycles, vehicle modification for wheelchair accessibility, prosthetic limbs, life experiences like throwing out the first pitch at a major league baseball game, or even going to the movies for the first time, we aim to strengthen not only a child’s physical abilities, but their confidence as well.

address.formatted: 5555 N Lamar Blvd Suite C-102, Austin, TX 78751, USA

places.name: William's Community School, The William Mosing Center
places.summary: William’s Community School offers full and part-time inclusive summer camp as well as providing alternative education. Summer camp is offered for 8 weeks. Therapy services of Speech, Occupational and Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA) therapy are offered as well. Services designed to adapt to communication and behavioral challenges for children who need additional support in these areas.

address.formatted: 5209 Duval Rd, Austin, TX 78727, USA
